title: Appendix: Clean OSCN Charge Descriptions
text: ojoRegex package collection regular expressions can used clean extract information court data, particular data Oklahoma State Court Network (OSCN). appendix provides list unique charge descriptions OSCN data cleaned ojoRegex package. ojoRegex::ojo_apply_regex() function begins table regex strings (ojoregex::ojo_regex_flags) correspond broad concepts like “marijuana”, “seatbelt”, “permit”. function takes list raw charge descriptions, checks one match regular expressions table, applying “flag” concept finds. Next, classifies description cleaned charge description / category (ojoregex::ojo_regex_cats) based concept flags present. example, “drugs” flag, “possess” flag, “intent” flag found, charge classified “CDS Possession (PWID)”. Alternatively, “drugs” flag “possess” flag found, “paraphernalia” flag also present, “CDS Paraphernalia Possession / Distribution” applied instead. list flags cleaned descriptions can found Google Sheet. Note every charge Oklahoma state statutes incorporated package just yet.

title: Appendix: Clean OSCN Charge Descriptions
text: appendix covers charge descriptions OSCN data filed felony, misdemeanor, traffic cases 2010 2024. 215,492 total unique charge descriptions data, appearing least 1,000 times 2010 - 2024 (489 unique descriptions) included brevity. full list, please contact Andrew Bell abell@okpolicy.org.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Bell. Author, maintainer. Brancen Gregory. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bell , Gregory B (2025). ojoregex: Regex Categorization Tools OJO Analysts. R package version 0.10.1, https://openjusticeok.github.io/ojoregex/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ojoregex: Regex Categorization Tools for OJO Analysts},   author = {Andrew Bell and Brancen Gregory},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.10.1},   url = {https://openjusticeok.github.io/ojoregex/}, }

title: Regex Categorization Tools for OJO Analysts
text: package includes functions clean data sources. part ojoverse. Currently, focuses cleaning hand-entered charge descriptions court / jail / etc. data. Analysts can use ojoregex::ojo_apply_regex() function clean hand-entered charge description data, OSCN, OCDC, elsewhere. works best OSCN data, since ’s primarily built thus far. also includes table notes charges covers. table includes relevant statutes, circumstances charge felony misdemeanor, SQ 780 relevance, violent crime status, useful notes, structured can easily joined onto dataset ojo_apply_regex(.include_cats = TRUE) function / argument. make development easier, flags categories / notes stored edited Google Sheet known Big Ol Regex Sheet. don’t want code directly relying connection though, copy saved .RDS file version ojoRegex.

title: Regex Categorization Tools for OJO Analysts
text: ojoRegex package uses concept flags categorize charge descriptions clean, consistent categories. word boundary round abbreviated words really important one; without , flag get applied anything “reg” anywhere, like “regulate” “pregnant”. one fairly simple, hopefully illustrates process making flags. Aug 13, 2024, nearly 240 concept flags ojoRegex package. ojo_apply_regex() starts pre-cleaning data regex_pre_clean(), removing common extraneous things like “CONCERT BILLY BOB” can screw regex false positives. pre-cleaning steps live pre_clean.R. Next, checks charge description dataset 200+ concept flags. pretty memory intensive can take ; ’s probably single inefficient part whole thing. Afterwards, data 200+ new columns TRUE FALSE depending whether concept present. example, following line defines pattern Grand Larceny: larceny & grand & !petit & !any_drugs ~ "Larceny (Grand)", words, uncleaned description says anything larceny, anything word “grand”, nothing word “petit”, nothing drugs, ’s Grand Larceny. Conversely, ’s line defines Larceny CDS: any_drugs & larceny ~ "Larceny CDS", Like concept flags , created going back forth data tinkering definitions results looked way wanted look. First, earlier lines take precedence later ones. ’s accessory ~ "Accessory Felony" right top — says anything accessory, want classified “Accessory Felony” regardless actual felony . can use override things, like case, can specify things end act kind “hasn’t categorized already, ” thing (case “Conspiracy” right now, example). also just generally keep mind ’re working function. approach acknowledges ambiguity, leaves analyst decide specific case. adding necessary, charges won’t one . ’re useful cases ’ve got several different kinds charge, like grand vs. petit larceny, Burglary vs. Burglary II, etc. Finally, joins categories notes onto cleaned charges (like whether charge violent crime, drug crime, property crime, etc., whether ’s one charges amended SQ 780, etc.) returns result. can see results using OSCN appendix. Currently, covers around 95% charge descriptions CF / CM / TR cases 2000 2023. can keep adding new ones needed almost everything covered.

text: function processes dataset charges adds columns classify maximum sentence types calculate control ranks based severity sentences.

title: Add controlling charges to the dataset — ojo_add_controlling_charges
Add controlling charges to the dataset — ojo_add_controlling_charges
text: ojo_regex_cats data frame containing charge information, including columns max_sentence_first_offense max_sentence_any.

title: Add controlling charges to the dataset — ojo_add_controlling_charges
text: data frame additional columns sentence classifications control ranks.

title: Apply OJO Regex — ojo_apply_regex
text: function applies regular expressions patterns clean categorize charge descriptions given dataset.

title: Apply OJO Regex — ojo_apply_regex
code: ojo_apply_regex(   data,   col_to_clean = "count_as_filed",   .keep_flags = FALSE,   .include_cats = TRUE,   .quiet = FALSE )

title: Apply OJO Regex — ojo_apply_regex
text: data data frame containing dataset processed. col_to_clean name column dataset containing charge descriptions cleaned categorized. .keep_flags Logical value indicating whether keep concept flags generated processing. Defaults FALSE, returns cleaned dataset without flags. .include_cats Logical value indiciating whether categories / subcategories included returned data .quiet progress bar shown?

title: Apply OJO Regex — ojo_apply_regex
text: cleaned categorized dataset charge descriptions specified column, along additional columns present original dataset.

title: Apply OJO Regex — ojo_apply_regex
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load example dataset data(example_data)  # Apply OJO Regex to clean and categorize charge descriptions cleaned_data <- apply_ojo_regex(data = example_data, col_to_clean = "charge_description") } # }
